alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 6:24PM EDT until July 27 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Montgomery County in central Maryland... Southeastern Loudoun County in northern Virginia... The City of Fairfax in northern Virginia... The northwestern City of Falls Church in northern Virginia... Northern Fairfax County in northern Virginia... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 623 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Countryside to near Brambleton to near Arcola, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Centreville, Rockville, Bethesda, Reston, Annandale, South Riding, Herndon, Fairfax, Vienna, Falls Church, Lowes Island, Mantua, Pimmit Hills, Mclean, American Legion Bridge, Dulles International Airport, Potomac, North Bethesda, Oakton and Sterling. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
